marketNews.title: MSCI: BREN, CUAN, and PTRO Remain Excluded from May 2025 Review
marketNews.content: MSCI on Friday (11/4) announced that Barito Renewables Energy ($BREN), Petrindo Jaya Kreasi ($CUAN), and Petrosea ($PTRO) will remain excluded from inclusion in the May 2025 index review. This announcement was an update after MSCI opened input from market participants and investors regarding the investment viability of these three stocks. Previously, MSCI determined that BREN, CUAN, and PTRO would not be included in the MSCI Indonesia Investable Market Index in the February 2025 index review due to potential investability constraints. In the announcement on Friday (11/4), MSCI also explained that it is reviewing the addition of regulations where stocks on the IDX that have been included in unusual market activity (UMA) announcements and/or monitoring boards due to unusual price movements in the last 12 months will not be considered for inclusion in the MSCI Global Investable Market Indexes. MSCI opened input from market participants regarding these regulatory changes until June 20, 2025, with updates to be announced on July 11, 2025. For additional information, here are the last dates BREN, CUAN, and PTRO received UMA signs and/or monitoring board inclusion: BREN: June 20, 2024 (last trading day in the special monitoring board). CUAN: January 8, 2025 (UMA). PTRO: September 4, 2024 (UMA). Following the MSCI announcement, the share prices of BREN, CUAN, and PTRO closed up +9.71%, +7.5%, and +4% respectively on Monday (14/4). Key Takeaway: We assess that the precedent set by these three stocks, along with potential additional regulations related to UMA and the special monitoring board, may complicate a stock's prospect of entering the MSCI Global Investable Market Indexes. If realized, this regulation addition would increase the influence of regulators - in this case, the IDX - in determining the eligibility of a stock for inclusion in the MSCI index.

marketNews.title: US President Donald Trump Insists on Tariffs for Imported Electronics; Indonesia Proposes USD 18-19 Billion Import Increase to Mitigate Trade Deficit
marketNews.content: US President, Donald Trump, said on Sunday (13/4) that he will still impose tariffs on imported smartphones, computers, and other popular electronic goods. Trump's clarification came after these goods were exempted from reciprocal tariffs last weekend. Trump also signaled that details regarding tariffs for semiconductor commodities would be announced this week. The Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, Susiwijono Moegiarso, stated that the Indonesian government proposed importing approximately 18-19 billion US dollars worth of US goods in a tariff negotiation proposal with the US government. This proposal aims to cover the US trade deficit with Indonesia, which was recorded at 16.8 billion US dollars during 2024. Additionally, the Deputy Minister of Investment and Downstreaming of Indonesia, Todotua Pasaribu, mentioned that the proposal also suggests that Indonesian State-Owned Enterprises (BUMN) invest in the US oil, gas, and information technology sectors. Chief Investment Officer of BPI Danantara, Pandu Sjahrir, said on Monday (14/4) that they are ready to become a liquidity provider in the Indonesian capital market. Pandu's statement came after the Chairman of the OJK Supervisory Board, Mahendra Siregar, stated on Friday (11/4) that the OJK had coordinated with BPI Danantara to encourage government-owned financial service institutions to make larger investments in the capital market as institutional investors. Pandu mentioned that BPI Danantara is currently reviewing a plan for fund placement derived from dividend income to be received at the end of April 2025. The China Customs Administration noted that China's coal imports decreased by -6.4% YoY to 38.73 million tons in March 2025. This realization was pressed down by high port inventories and weak domestic demand, pushing spot market prices to their lowest level in the last four years. This result also marked the first annual decline in China's coal imports since March 2022, excluding the January-February period when the year-on-year comparison was influenced by the Lunar New Year holiday. The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded that domestic motorcycle sales reached 541,684 units in March 2025 (-7.2% YoY, -6.8% MoM). This result brought total domestic motorcycle sales during 3M25 to approximately 1.7 million units (-3% YoY), equivalent to 25-26% of AISI's 2025 target set around 6.4-6.7 million units. President Prabowo Subianto claimed on Sunday (13/4) that Qatar has committed to investing 2 billion US dollars in a joint fund for BPI Danantara. Goldman Sachs raised its gold price forecast to 3,700 US dollars per troy ounce by the end of 2025, driven by growing concerns about the US economy amid the escalation of the trade war with China. This marks the third upgrade to the gold price outlook from Goldman Sachs this year, after the investment bank raised its 2025 gold price target to 3,300 US dollars per troy ounce in March 2025. Goldman Sachs also warned that, in an extreme risk scenario, the price of gold could reach 4,500 US dollars per troy ounce by the end of 2025. Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of March 2025 rose to 157.1 billion US dollars (vs. February 2025: 154.5 billion US dollars), equivalent to financing 6.7 months of imports or 6.5 months of imports and government foreign debt payments. This development was influenced by tax and service receipts as well as the drawdown of government foreign loans, amidst the policy of stabilizing the Rupiah exchange rate. Pertamina Geothermal Energy ($PGEO) signed a joint study agreement with the Turkish company, Zorlu Enerji Elektrik Uretim A.S., as a step to explore cooperation in the development of a Geothermal Power Plant (PLTP) project in Zorlu Enerji's geothermal working area in Turkey.

marketNews.title: Motorcycle Sales Declined in March 2025, AISI Target Achievement Reaches 25-26%
marketNews.content: The Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association (AISI) recorded that domestic motorcycle sales reached 541,684 units in March 2025 (-7.2% YoY, -6.8% MoM). This result brought total domestic motorcycle sales during 3M25 to approximately 1.7 million units (-3% YoY), equivalent to 25-26% of AISI's 2025 target set around 6.4-6.7 million units.

marketNews.title: Foreign Exchange Reserves Increased to USD 157.1 Billion in March 2025
marketNews.content: Bank Indonesia noted that Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves at the end of March 2025 rose to 157.1 billion US dollars (vs. February 2025: 154.5 billion US dollars), equivalent to financing 6.7 months of imports or 6.5 months of imports and government foreign debt payments. This development was influenced by tax and service receipts as well as the drawdown of government foreign loans, amidst the policy of stabilizing the Rupiah exchange rate.

tickerNews.title: ERAA Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 50 Billion
tickerNews.content: ERAA: Erajaya Swasembada plans to conduct a share buyback with an allocation of up to fifty billion rupiah from April 14 to July 13, 2025. The company did not specify the maximum number of shares to be repurchased in this corporate action. This plan does not require the approval of the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS), in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: PGAS Announced Termination of Gas Purchase Agreement with West Natuna Energy Ltd.
tickerNews.content: PGAS: Perusahaan Gas Negara announced that the gas purchase agreement with West Natuna Energy Ltd. in the Duyung Block was terminated on April 12, 2025. The termination of this agreement resulted in a reduction of PGAS's gas supply projection by 122.77 TBTU.

tickerNews.title: OASA's Subsidiary to Build Waste-to-Energy Plant Worth IDR 2.6 Trillion in South Tangerang
tickerNews.content: OASA: The President Director of Maharaksa Biru Energi, Bobby Gafur Umar, stated that his company will build a waste-to-energy power plant (PLTSa) worth 2.6 trillion rupiah in Cipeucang, South Tangerang. The PLTSa will be built through a consortium owned by OASA's subsidiary, PT Indoplas Energi Hijau, and China Tianying Inc, where PT Indoplas Energi Hijau will be the controller in the consortium. The Cipeucang PLTSa is targeted to begin operating in 2028 with an electricity production capacity of 25 MW. Of this amount, approximately 5 MW will be used for self-consumption, and approximately 20 MW will be sold to PLN.

tickerNews.title: TBLA Plans Share Buyback Up to IDR 200 Billion
tickerNews.content: TBLA: Tunas Baru Lampung plans to conduct a buyback of up to 300 million (4.97%) shares with an allocation of up to 200 billion rupiah from April 14 to July 13, 2025. This plan does not require the approval of the General Meeting of Shareholders (RUPS), in line with the relaxation provided by the OJK to support capital market stability.

tickerNews.title: LTLS Indirectly Controls PT Lautan Organo Water After Acquiring 21% Stake
tickerNews.content: LTLS: Lautan Luas, through its subsidiary, PT Lautan Air Indonesia, announced that it has purchased a 21% stake in its business entity, PT Lautan Organo Water, worth 16.3 billion rupiah from Organo Corporation. Following this transaction, LTLS indirectly becomes the controller of PT Lautan Organo Water.

tickerNews.title: HILL Controller Sells 27.5 Million Shares
tickerNews.content: HILL: The controller of Hillcon, PT Hillcon Equity Management, sold 27.5 million HILL shares at a price of 360 rupiah per share on April 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 9.9 billion rupiah. After this transaction, the ownership of PT Hillcon Equity Management in HILL decreased from 57.72% to 57.54%.

tickerNews.title: FUTR Shareholder Increases Stake via Share Purchase
tickerNews.content: FUTR: Futura Energi Global shareholder, Vincent le Kok Hui, purchased approximately 64.9 million FUTR shares at a price of 77 rupiah per share on April 10, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 5 billion rupiah. After this transaction, Vincent's ownership in FUTR increased from 4.26% to 5.24%.

tickerNews.title: Two RAJA Directors Purchased Shares
tickerNews.content: RAJA: Two directors of Rukun Raharja, Djauhar Maulidi and Ogi Rulino, each purchased 150,000 and 200,000 RAJA shares, respectively, at prices of 1,810 rupiah per share and 1,665 rupiah per share on March 27, 2025, and April 8, 2025. The total transaction value reached approximately 272 million rupiah and 333 million rupiah, respectively. Following these transactions, the ownership of Djauhar and Ogi in RAJA increased, but each remains around 0.001% and 0.0005%.

tickerNews.title: PGEO Signs Joint Study Agreement with Zorlu Enerji in Turkey
tickerNews.content: Pertamina Geothermal Energy ($PGEO) signed a joint study agreement with the Turkish company, Zorlu Enerji Elektrik Uretim A.S., as a form of exploring cooperation in the development of a Geothermal Power Plant (PLTP) project in Zorlu Enerji's geothermal working area in Turkey.
